title: Error updating eth1 chain cache
body: This is the general error displayed when running the project JSON RPC error: query returned more than 10000 results On git cloning the lodestar project and installing the necessary dependencies. Running the project produced the following error, Steps to reproduce Download the project and install the necessary dependencies. run the project

```
Jun-10 17:26:13.970 [ETH1]            error: Error updating eth1 chain cache message=JSON RPC error: query returned more than 10000 results, method=eth_getLogs, params=[{"fromBlock":"0x391f63","toBlock":"0x39234a","address":"0x8c5fecdc472e27bc447696f431e425d02dd46a8c","topics":["0x649bbc62d0e31342afea4e5cd82d4049e7e1ee912fc0889aa790803be39038c5"]}]
Error: JSON RPC error: query returned more than 10000 results, method=eth_getLogs, params=[{"fromBlock":"0x391f63","toBlock":"0x39234a","address":"0x8c5fecdc472e27bc447696f431e425d02dd46a8c","topics":["0x649bbc62d0e31342afea4e5cd82d4049e7e1ee912fc0889aa790803be39038c5"]}]    at parseRpcResponse (/home/cayman/Code/lodestar/packages/lodestar/src/eth1/jsonRpcHttpClient.ts:60:9)
    at JsonRpcHttpClient.fetch (/home/cayman/Code/lodestar/packages/lodestar/src/eth1/jsonRpcHttpClient.ts:39:12)
    at processTicksAndRejections (internal/process/task_queues.js:93:5)
    at Eth1Provider.getLogs (/home/cayman/Code/lodestar/packages/lodestar/src/eth1/eth1JsonRpcClient.ts:104:21)
    at async Promise.all (index 0)
    at retry (/home/cayman/Code/lodestar/packages/lodestar/src/util/retry.ts:27:14)
    at Eth1Provider.getDepositEvents (/home/cayman/Code/lodestar/packages/lodestar/src/eth1/eth1Provider.ts:27:24)
    at Eth1ForBlockProduction.updateDepositCache (/home/cayman/Code/lodestar/packages/lodestar/src/eth1/eth1ForBlockProduction.ts:148:27)
    at Eth1ForBlockProduction.update (/home/cayman/Code/lodestar/packages/lodestar/src/eth1/eth1ForBlockProduction.ts:134:31)
    at Eth1ForBlockProduction.runAutoUpdate (/home/cayman/Code/lodestar/packages/lodestar/src/eth1/eth1ForBlockProduction.ts:116:28)
```

Here is also the original screenshot to support @wemeetagain findings.

![lodestar_error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/681817/121605356-43c6e200-ca1a-11eb-8934-080ac9318fb5.png)
This seems to have been fixed in the latest release.

I'm still getting this with v0.28.0 on Pyrmont testnet.

